alert.note: Alert for Klamath (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 4:48PM PDT until May 09 at 4:47PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Sprague River near Beatty affecting Klamath County. .The Sprague River near Beatty gauge is reporting levels below Flood Stage but above Action Stage. While the river is below Flood Stage at the gauge, fields downstream remain flooded. It will take some time for those fields to drain so the flood impacts are expected to continue as long as the river remains above Action Stage through early next week. For the Sprague River...including Beatty...elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1100 AM PDT. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Sprague River near Beatty. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Widespread agricultural flooding can be expected downstream in the Sprague River Valley in the vicinity of Sprague River and Lone Pine. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM PDT Saturday, May 06 the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near 8.0 feet. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
